jobDescription:
At BBH we value diverse backgrounds, so if your experience looks a little different from what we've outlined and you think you can bring value to the role, we will still welcome your application!

Senior Network Technical Support/Engineer

Brown Brothers Harriman is currently recruiting Senior Network Technical Support/Engineer to join our Network Engineering group.

Position Summary:

As a Senior Network Technical Support/Engineer, you will provide technical support for all aspects of connectivity within the enterprise data and wireless communication networks.  This will include network systems installation/maintenance, problem resolution, network documentation, client support, and network performance monitoring.  You will work with Information Technology (IT) teams that span across multiple business functions and geographic locations.

Responsibilities:

  • Ability to implement, administer, and troubleshoot network infrastructure devices such as wireless access points, routers, and switches.

  • Monitor the operation of the network related systems to ensure proper functioning of WAN circuits, hardware, and software.

  • Resolution of Level1-2 network related incidents and/or escalation to Level3 support.

  • Maintain technical specifications and documents, drawings, system documentation and operating procedures.

  • Work with clients, vendors and carriers during problem analysis/resolution as required.

  • Installation and maintenance of network related monitoring and administrative systems.

  • Respond to client inquiries and issues, escalating as needed.

  • Network capacity planning and performance monitoring.

  • Change and incident management.

Relevant Experiences and Qualifications:

  • BA/BS Degree, or Technical Degree (preferred)

  • 6+ years’ experience in installation and maintenance of complex networks, CCNA or CWNA highly preferred/desired. CompTIA, A+, Network Certificates a plus

  • Must demonstrate excellent knowledge of LAN/WAN, Wireless, TCP/IP protocols and network technologies.

    • Experience in designing, building, and operation WiFi networks.

    • Experience with conducting WLAN enterprise site surveys and network design tool such as Ekahau

    • RF Survey/Engineering and RF troubleshooting skills with Cisco WLAN and Spectrum Analyzer tools

    • Deep understanding of current 802.11 standards, 802.1x, and TCP/UDP/IP

    • Assist in the development of network implementation planning

  • Strong diagnostic, problem-solving and analytical skills.

  • Proven ability to troubleshoot and support technical issues both remotely and on-site using standard network tools and techniques.

  • Hands-on experience in the use of protocol analysis tools for data packet inspection.

  • Good oral and written communication skills.
